channel.title: Modem Advice
channel.description:
After renting a modem from the cable company for years, we're looking into buying one of our own since buying one pays for itself in no time compared to renting one.
We've got Internet, TV, and VoIP(Vonage).
What sort of specifics should I be looking for in a modem? I need something that will last and something that can handle medium to heavy traffic, residential use only
thanks :D

item.title: Modem Advice
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

I ended up getting the SB6120: http://reviews.bestbuy.com/3545/9246693/motorola-surfboard-extreme-broadband-cable-modem-reviews/reviews.htm

thank you for the offer though

Read full topic

item.title: Modem Advice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I have a Motorola SURFboard that I used with Time Warner cable that I’d give you for free if it’ll work for you. You will have to pay shipping though, so it may not be worth it?

Read full topic

item.title: Modem Advice
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

If your looking for something pretty fast, with a stable connection try this one. MOTOROLA SB5101U SURFboard Cable Modem. Any of the SURFboard modems are pretty good, just pick one that fits your needs.

Read full topic

item.title: Modem Advice
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Pretty much anything will work.

Read full topic

item.title: Modem Advice
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

chri5:

I’d suggest anything which runs openwrt/tomato/whatever

that’s a router and the free routers given in the uk are subpar quality

Read full topic

item.title: Modem Advice
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

wait u have to pay to rent a router? in uk you’ve given them for free…

I’d suggest anything which runs openwrt/tomato/whatever

Read full topic
